description: The 'draw_measurement' function generates educational stimulus images that depict measurements in either liquid volume (milliliters or liters) or weight (grams or kilograms). The images are designed to help students understand and visualize different units of measurement and their conversions.

educational_standards.description: Measure and estimate liquid volumes using liters (l).
Measure and estimate the masses of objects using standard units of grams (g) and kilograms (kg).
Solve one-step word problems by subtracting quantities of liquid volumes given in the same units.
Solve one-step word problems by multiplying quantities of masses or volumes given in the same units.
Solve word problems involving two step division.
Use the four operations to solve word problems involving liquid volumes, including problems that require expressing measurements given in a larger unit in terms of a smaller unit.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Measurement Visualizations
stimulus_type_specification.description: The 'draw_measurement' function can create two types of visualizations: a cup filled with liquid to represent volume measurements, and an analog scale to represent weight measurements. The function accepts inputs based on the 'Measurements' class, which includes the measurement value, units (milliliters, liters, grams, kilograms), and color for the liquid or weight. The function validates the units and converts them if necessary, and it calculates the dimensions and scale parameters for the visualization. These images can be used in educational settings to teach students about different units of measurement and how to convert between them.

details: Measurement: The value to be represented in the visualization
Units: The units of the measurement, which must be milliliters, liters, grams, or kilograms
Color: The color of the liquid or weight in the visualization
The units must be either milliliters, liters, grams, or kilograms
The measurement value must be a positive number
The color must be a valid color name or hex code
The function draws a cup filled with liquid for volume measurements, with a scale on the side to represent the measurement value
For weight measurements, the function draws an analog scale with the measurement value
The color of the liquid or weight is determined by the 'color' input
